alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 12:52PM PDT until May 10 at 8:12AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning May 10. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Overflow from Salmon Falls Creek will completely inundate the rest area along U.S. 93, about 3 miles south of Jackpot, NV. Water may begin encroaching upon the shoulder of U.S. 93 near the rest area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PDT Wednesday, May 3 the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.6 feet by Monday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 05/18/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
